node_mapping.motivation: The article discusses the federal takeover of local law enforcement in D.C., which aligns with the existing node on Trump's Federal Control of D.C. Police, highlighting the intersection of federal and local governance in law enforcement.

article_node.title: As federal activity takes root in DC, police chief orders more cooperation with immigration agents
article_node.summary: The Washington, D.C. police chief has mandated increased cooperation between local officers and federal immigration officials amid President Trump's law enforcement takeover of the city. This order allows the Metropolitan Police Department to share information with immigration agencies and assist in transporting detained individuals. The National Guard has been deployed for various missions, including security and community safety, while visible federal presence has heightened in response to recent protests and arrests related to immigration enforcement.
